caption:
The photograph captures an elderly man engaged in the activity of knitting. He is shown from a slightly elevated angle, concentrating on his knitting. The man wears glasses with a thick black rim and has short white hair. He is dressed in a patterned shirt with ornamental designs and a dark tie, which reflects a personal sense of style.

The background features a decorative, festive wallpaper with motifs of lanterns, ribbons, and what appears to be foliage, suggesting a possibly cozy and homely setting. The warm tones of the wallpaper and lighting enhance the intimate and serene mood of the scene.

The man's hands are focused on the knitting needles and yarn, demonstrating dexterity and attentiveness to his craft. This scene exemplifies a moment of peaceful, everyday life, showcasing a hobby that requires patience and skill. The facial expression of the man, though partly obscured, seems reflective and absorbed in the task.
title: Older citizens, retired persons and those unable to care for themselves physically are cared for in two community centers. This man lives at the Highland Manor Retirement Home, keeping busy with "old country" crafts. New Ulm is a county seat trading center of 13,000 in a farming area of south central Minnesota. It was founded in 1854 by a German immigrant land company that encouraged its kinsmen to emigrate from Europe.
